_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five kinds of emotional barrenness t: Anger and upset with spiritual companions
The five emotional shackles they haven’t: Greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures
Eating as much as they like until their belly is full, then indulging in the pleasures of sleeping, lying down, and drowsing
Leading the spiritual life wishing to be reborn in one of the orders of gods
The five kinds of emotional barrenness t: Not angry and upset with spiritual companions
The five emotional shackles they’ve cut: Rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures
Rid of greed for the body
Not eating as much as they like until their belly is full, then indulging in the pleasures of sleeping, lying down, and drowsing
Not leading the spiritual life wishing to be reborn in one of the orders of gods
